title: Creating Abundance in an Arid Climate

tasks.task: Engage in regenerative grazing practices on a cattle ranch in a semi-arid environment.
subtasks: Manage a fifth-generation family ranch in northern Chihuahua, Mexico.
Shift from traditional ranching methods to regenerative grazing practices in 2016.
Increase carrying capacity by three times through intensive grazing management.
Implement over 500 portable paddocks for year-round grazing with a rest period of 425 days per paddock.
Perform daily cattle moves, monitoring health and forage quality.
Utilize polywire fencing and automated water management systems for efficient pasture rotation.
Establish a hogging-down system for cow-calf operations and stocker cattle.
Partner with conservation organizations like the Rocky Mountain Bird Conservancy for habitat improvement.
Share expertise through consulting and peer networks for continuous improvement in regenerative ranching.
Advise new ranchers to adopt regenerative practices, emphasizing mindset change and professional consultation.
